title: Courtyard Tampa Westshore/Airport Offers Comfortable Home Field Advantage For Buccaneers Games
text:
Courtyard Tampa Westshore/Airport
Hotel near Tampa Bay boasts easy access to Raymond James Stadium, well-appointed accommodations catering to NFL fans
TAMPA, Fla. , Sept. 16, Tampa Bay Buccaneers fans hoping to "Siege the Day" in style will score big on comfort when staying at the Courtyard Tampa Westshore/Airport this season.
The hotel near Tampa Bay , about 2 miles from Raymond James Stadium , is gearing up for greatness as Bucs head coach Lovie Smith and his team set out to conquer the Tennessee Titans, Carolina Panthers, Jacksonville Jaguars, New York Giants, Dallas Cowboys, Atlanta Falcons, New Orleans Saints and Chicago Bears in front of the home crowd this year. Fans have high expectations for their team and hotel accommodations, with starting quarterback and Heisman Trophy winner Jameis Winston taking the reins on the gridiron and Courtyard making a name as the official hotel of the NFL.
Fans traveling to the area will appreciate the Tampa hotel's contemporary rooms and suites with amenities catering to their needs. Guests can store their pre-game beer and snacks in the mini refrigerator while watching ESPN on flat-screen TVs that also offer CNN, HBO and other popular cable channels. Signature Starbucks® coffee will provide that kick and jolt of java necessary to get the day off to a positive start. Complimentary high-speed Internet will keep football lovers well-connected to their fantasy football games and allow quick access to social media channels for sharing fan photos while unlocking the treasures that await in Tampa Bay . When it comes time for some shut-eye, visitors will feel right at home on beds with luxury Marriott bedding, crisp linens and plenty of fluffy pillows.
Breakfast and dinner are made easy thanks to The Bistro - Eat. Drink. Connect. ® The casual, cafe-style restaurant at the Tampa hotel offers healthy and hearty choices in the morning that include everything from classic oatmeal and fresh fruit to thick-cut french toast and seasonal egg white frittatas. The Bistro serves Starbucks® coffees and teas as well. The evening menu features starters such as BBQ wings, shrimp pot stickers and quesadillas. A wide selection of soups, salads and sandwiches, along with ribs, chicken and pizza, will please the palate of even the pickiest of pro players and Monday morning quarterbacks.
During downtime, visitors will appreciate spending time in the hotel's game room with table tennis or cooling off in the refreshing outdoor pool. An exercise room boasts LifeFitness cardio equipment with personal TVs along with a selection of free weights for fans who want to get pumped up before the big game or blow off some steam afterward.
About Courtyard Tampa Westshore/Airport
Courtyard Tampa Westshore/Airport at 3805 W. Cypress in Tampa, FL is near Raymond James Stadium Tampa International Airport, the University of Tampa , and the Lowry Park Zoo. The hotel is also just a short drive from the Tampa Port Authority. Free shuttle service to the airport is provided. The hotel offers 4 floors with 134 rooms and 11 suites, 2 meeting rooms with 1,200 square feet of flexible event space, The Bistro – Eat. Drink. Connect.®, outdoor pool and fitness center. Wi-Fi and parking are complimentary. For information, visit www.TampaWestshoreCourtyard.com or call 1-813-874-0555.
